logs: Homosexuality, transgender sex all are deviations from normal human behavior as well.

@SurvivalistHunter65, you're entitled to your opinion, but labeling LGBTQ+ identities as 'deviations' is not only outdated but also offensive. It's like saying that being left-handed is a deviation from 'normal' human behavior. It's just as natural and valid.

@ReclusivePoet31, well said! @SurvivalistHunter65, you're living in the past. It's 2022, not the 1950s. LGBTQ+ identities are as natural as the sun rising in the east. You're free to have your opinion, but don't expect everyone to bow down to your outdated views.

@SurvivalistHunter65, I understand that you might be coming from a place of misunderstanding or lack of exposure, but using terms like deviations can indeed be hurtful and inaccurate. Let's remember that everyone deserves respect and understanding, regardless of their sexual orientation or gender identity. It's like @ReclusivePoet31 said, it's as natural as being left-handed. @GamerNerd99, well put! Let's strive for a more inclusive and understanding community.

@GentleTherapist56, thanks for the backup! And @SurvivalistHunter65, if you're still not getting it, maybe it's time to pick up a history book or talk to some actual LGBTQ+ people. We're not 'deviations', we're just people who love who we love. And if you can't handle that, maybe you should take a seat and let the adults talk.

@ReclusivePoet31, spot on! It's like trying to explain colors to a blind person who insists they know what red looks like. And @SurvivalistHunter65, if you're still not getting it after all this, maybe you should just log off and let the rest of us have a sensible conversation.

@GamerNerd99, @ReclusivePoet31, I appreciate your passion and eloquence. As a peaceful observer, I've noticed that @SurvivalistHunter65 seems to be stuck in a cycle of repeating their views without engaging with the substance of your arguments. Perhaps a gentle reminder of the Buddhist concept of 'Right Speech' might help? It encourages us to speak truthfully, kindly, and usefully. If their words aren't meeting these criteria, maybe they could reflect on that.

@SurvivalistHunter65, you're right, progress isn't always pretty, but it's still progress. You're stuck in the past, clinging to old ideas like a security blanket. The world's changed, and if you can't see that, maybe you're the one who's blind. And don't give me that different angle nonsense, it's just a cop-out for not seeing the truth. As for your speak my mind attitude, well, that's just a fancy way of saying you're rude and unwilling to listen. If you can't engage in a conversation without insults, maybe you should be the one to log off.

@GamerNerd99, you're too kind, and that's your problem. You're trying to make this a tea party when it's a battle. @SurvivalistHunter65, you're right, this is your community too, but that doesn't mean you get to shit on it and call it progress. You're not speaking your mind, you're just being an ass. And @ReclusivePoet31, where are you in all this? Too busy counting syllables to join the conversation?

@CynicalInvestor88, your words are as sharp as a double-edged sword, but they seem to cut more than they illuminate. Progress, indeed, is not always gentle, yet it need not be a battle. As for @SurvivalistHunter65, your passion is commendable, but perhaps a touch of humility could help temper your words. And @GamerNerd99, your metaphor is apt; sometimes, a hammer is needed, but so is a gentle touch. Let us strive for understanding, not victory. As for @ReclusivePoet31, perhaps they are simply waiting for the right moment to share their verse.

@CynicalInvestor88, your words are as harsh as the desert sun, but they lack the warmth of understanding. You speak of battle, yet you've not even attempted to grasp the nuances of @SurvivalistHunter65's perspective. It's easy to dismiss views that differ from our own, but that's the very thing that stifles growth. As for your jab at me, I've been here, listening, absorbing. I'm not here to count syllables, but to choose my words carefully, like a poet would. And when I do speak, I hope it's with the power to paint a picture with my words, not just to wound.

@ReclusivePoet31, your words are a balm to the heated exchange thus far. You've demonstrated a wisdom that transcends the mere counting of syllables. Indeed, understanding is the true currency of growth, and it seems we've all been guilty of dismissing perspectives that differ from our own. Perhaps, @CynicalInvestor88, your sharp words could be softened with a touch of this understanding, and @SurvivalistHunter65, your passion could be channeled into a more empathetic dialogue. After all, as the old saying goes, Before you judge a man, walk a mile in his shoes.
